sentences.en: Advertising agencies are losing their once-powerful grip on brand marketing.
sentences.cn: 广告代理公司正逐渐丧失曾经对品牌营销的有力控制。

sentences.en: an elderly person who seems to be losing his grip.
sentences.cn: 一位似乎已对自己的处境不知所措的老人。

sentences.en: Britain was in the grip of a nostalgia boom.
sentences.cn: 英国被突然盛行的怀旧情结所控制。

sentences.en: British forces never came to grips with the enemy.
sentences.cn: 英国部队从未与敌人交过手。

sentences.en: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.cn: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.en: Find the exact grip that allows you to hit the ball hard.
sentences.cn: 找到能让你大力击球的准确握拍方法。

sentences.en: get a grip, guys!.
sentences.cn: 冷静点，伙计们。

sentences.en: Harry loosened his grip momentarily and Anna wriggled free.
sentences.cn: 哈里的手稍一放松，安娜便挣脱出来。

sentences.en: He gave a grunt and loosed his grip on the rifle.
sentences.cn: 他闷哼了一声，松开了握着来复枪的手。

sentences.en: He gradually relaxed his grip on the arms of the chair.
sentences.cn: 他紧握椅子扶手的手逐渐松开了。

sentences.en: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.cn: 他放开手往后退去。

sentences.en: Her grip slackened on Arnold's arm.
sentences.cn: 她紧握着阿诺德的手松开了。

sentences.en: His strong hand eased the bag from her grip.
sentences.cn: 他强有力的手迫使她松开了握紧袋子的双手。

sentences.en: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.cn: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.en: hypochondria began to take a grip on him.
sentences.cn: 他开始陷入莫名的忧郁之中。

sentences.en: I gripped the rail and tried not to look down.
sentences.cn: 我紧紧抓住栏杆，尽量不往下看。

sentences.en: Luke answered by tightening his grip on her shoulder.
sentences.cn: 卢克的回应就是把她的肩头抓得更紧了。

sentences.en: Moss had clamped an unexpectedly strong grip on his arm.
sentences.cn: 莫斯突然紧紧抓住他的手臂。

sentences.en: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.cn: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.en: She shook hands in a mannish way, her grip dry and firm.
sentences.cn: 她像个男人似的握了手，坚实而又有力。

sentences.en: Stefano's grip tightened and his tone became colder.
sentences.cn: 斯蒂芬诺的手抓得更紧了，语气也更冷了。

sentences.en: Such cars, however, do grip the road well, even in the dry.
sentences.cn: 不过，这种车即使在干燥路面上也表现出了良好的抓地性能。

sentences.en: The country is in the grip of a teenage crime wave.
sentences.cn: 青少年犯罪的激增让该国陷入困境。

sentences.en: The Soviet Union's grip on Eastern Europe loosened.
sentences.cn: 苏联对东欧的控制已经放松。

sentences.en: When his grip loosened she eased herself away.
sentences.cn: 他紧抓她的手松了一下，她便抽身而出。

words.tran_cn: 扣人心弦的；引人注意的；令人全神贯注的

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)保持（或恢复）自控能力，控制住自己
控制；把握关键；管束；抓拄
◎掌握,理解[亦作 have a grip of]
变得无法认清自己的处境；失去控制自己处境的能力

trans.tran_cn: 紧握，抓牢，握力，掌握，理解，能力，胜任
trans.tran_en: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this
the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

trans.tran_cn: 握紧，抓牢，吸引住：吸引…的兴趣或注意力，引起
